publicationStmt.p: Published by Penn State Behrend, made available by the Arrow Archive.

physDesc.p: Mary Behrend, who founded Penn State Behrend, wrote notes to her husband Ernest on daily calender pages. Included were poems, jokes, and small illustrations. This file includes encoded versions of a couple of Mary's notes

These pages are contained in a family album that includes some photos of the Behrend children.
A stack of calendar pages sits on an open envelope to the left of a worn, aging album. Embossed on the album cover in blue string are the words 'Baby Days' as well as some flowers.

settingDesc.p: Pages were written in Erie, Pa, in the year 1909.

graphic.desc: A man is depicted sitting up in a bed, groggily rubbing his eye. Next to his bed is a table with a lamp and an alarm clock on it.

body.p:
E.R.B.
"That damned old clock
gives me a shock
Each morning where it's dark
It likes the fun, but I've become
So tired of the lark!"

p.style: sideways at the left of the page

body.p:
Everybody dressed best
For this is an Erie Tea
They eat too much, talk so much
You can bet they in me.

Molly on
Snowshoes
That Mr. Weir
Got.
Pretty picture
Is it not?!

He frightened all the snakes away-
I wish he'd try his art on smoke
Around the Hammermill some day!
